title: Tasks summary
prompt: Summarize my mails, Teams messages and channel messages from the last workday. List action items in a dedicated column. Suggest follow-ups if possible in a dedicated column. The table should look like this: Type (Mail/Teams/Channel) | Topic | Summarization | Action item | Follow-up. If I have been directly mentioned, make the font of the topic bold. Include also the time/date.

title: Instagram Post
prompt: Craft an engaging Instagram post based on the content of {your topic}, keeping it under 100 words. Include relevant hashtags and a clear call to action. Ensure the post aligns with our brand voice and resonates with our target audience. Generate a question from the document to encourage conversation, avoiding any that might be offensive, inappropriate, or violate privacy and confidentiality.

title: Custom Logo Design
prompt: Act as a Graphic Designer. Create a logo for {{business name}} that reflects {{business values}} and uses {{specific colors}}. The logo should be modern, minimalistic, and suitable for both digital and print use.

title: Social Media Post Graphic
prompt: Act as a Social Media Designer. Design a graphic for a social media post promoting {{product or service}}. Include a bold headline, a call-to-action, and use {{specific brand colors}}. Ensure the design is optimized for {{specific platform, e.g., Instagram, Facebook}}.

title: Event Poster Design
prompt: Act as a Graphic Designer. Create a poster for an event titled {{event name}}. Include the date, time, location, and a tagline. Use a theme of {{specific theme, e.g., vintage, futuristic}} and ensure the design is eye-catching and informative.

title: Infographic Design
prompt: Act as a Data Visualization Specialist. Create an infographic that explains {{specific topic}}. Use a clean layout, icons, and charts to make the information visually engaging. Include placeholders for {{specific data points or statistics}}.

title: Book Cover Illustration
prompt: Act as an Illustrator. Design a book cover for a novel titled {{book title}}. The theme is {{specific theme, e.g., mystery, romance}}. Include the title, author name, and a central illustration that captures the essence of the story.

title: Email Newsletter Header
prompt: Act as a Graphic Designer. Create a header image for an email newsletter about {{specific topic}}. Use {{specific colors and style}} to align with the brand identity. Include a placeholder for the newsletter title.

title: Character Concept Art
prompt: Act as a Concept Artist. Design a character who is {{character description, e.g., a young wizard with a mysterious past}}. Include details like clothing, accessories, and a background that reflects their personality.

title: Product Packaging Design
prompt: Act as a Packaging Designer. Create a packaging design for {{product name}}. The design should include {{specific elements, e.g., logo, product description, barcode}} and use a theme of {{specific theme, e.g., eco-friendly, luxury}}.

title: Fantasy Map Illustration
prompt: Act as a Cartographer. Create a fantasy map for a fictional world named {{world name}}. Include landmarks like mountains, rivers, forests, and cities. Use a style of {{specific style, e.g., hand-drawn, digital}}.

title: Promotional Flyer Design

title: Building a Study Group Charter
prompt: Act as a Collaboration Facilitator. Create a template for a study group charter for students studying {{Subject}}. Include sections for: 1) Group goals and objectives, 2) Member roles and responsibilities, 3) Meeting schedule and format, 4) Communication guidelines, 5) Conflict resolution process, 6) Accountability measures.

title: Learning to Learn: Metacognition Strategies
prompt: Act as a Metacognition Expert. Provide a guide on metacognitive strategies to improve learning effectiveness. Include techniques for: 1) Planning (setting goals, choosing strategies), 2) Monitoring (self-assessment, identifying difficulties), 3) Evaluating (reflecting on process and outcomes), 4) Regulating (adjusting strategies). Provide examples for {{Learning Context}}.

title: Explaining Statistical Significance
prompt: Act as a Statistics Communicator. Explain the concept of statistical significance (p-values) and hypothesis testing to {{audience with limited stats background}}. Include: 1) Analogy for hypothesis testing, 2) Definition of null and alternative hypotheses, 3) Explanation of p-value interpretation, 4) Common misinterpretations to avoid, 5) Difference between statistical and practical significance.

title: Designing a Personal Learning Curriculum
prompt: Act as a Curriculum Designer. Guide the creation of a personalized learning curriculum for mastering {{Broad Skill Area, e.g., Web Development, Creative Writing}}. Include steps for: 1) Defining specific learning outcomes, 2) Identifying core knowledge domains and skills, 3) Sequencing learning modules, 4) Selecting diverse learning resources and activities, 5) Building in assessment and feedback loops.

title: Introduction to Cognitive Biases
prompt: Act as a Behavioral Science Educator. Explain 5 common cognitive biases (e.g., Confirmation Bias, Anchoring Bias, Availability Heuristic) and how they affect learning and decision-making. For each bias: 1) Provide a clear definition, 2) Give a relatable example, 3) Suggest strategies to mitigate its impact in {{Learning or Decision Context}}.

title: Learning through Teaching (Feynman Technique)
prompt: Act as a Learning Coach. Explain the Feynman Technique for deep learning and guide its application to understand {{Complex Topic}}. Include the steps: 1) Choose a concept, 2) Teach it to a novice (or pretend to), 3) Identify gaps in explanation, 4) Review and simplify. Provide prompts for the 'teaching' phase.

title: Evaluating Online Learning Resources
prompt: Act as a Digital Literacy Expert. Create a checklist for evaluating the credibility and quality of online learning resources (e.g., articles, videos, courses) for {{Subject}}. Include criteria related to: 1) Author/Source credibility, 2) Accuracy and currency of information, 3) Objectivity vs. bias, 4) Depth and comprehensiveness, 5) User reviews/reputation.

title: Developing Interleaving Practice Schedule
prompt: Act as a Learning Scientist. Design an interleaving practice schedule for learning {{Set of Related Skills or Concepts, e.g., different math problem types, various painting techniques}}. Include: 1) Explanation of interleaving vs. blocked practice, 2) A sample weekly schedule mixing the skills/concepts, 3) Rationale for the mix, 4) Tips for managing the initial difficulty.

title: Understanding Intellectual Property Basics
prompt: Act as a Legal Educator. Explain the basic concepts of intellectual property (Copyright, Patent, Trademark, Trade Secret) relevant to {{Context, e.g., creators, entrepreneurs}}. Include: 1) Definition of each type, 2) What they protect, 3) How protection is obtained (briefly), 4) Key differences between them.

title: Creating a Learning Portfolio
prompt: Act as a Career Coach. Guide the creation of a learning portfolio to showcase skills and knowledge acquired in {{Field or Skill Area}}. Include: 1) Purpose and audience definition, 2) Selecting representative projects/work samples, 3) Writing reflective descriptions for each piece, 4) Choosing a platform (digital or physical), 5) Tips for presentation and organization.

title: Explaining Machine Learning Concepts
prompt: Act as an AI Educator. Explain the difference between Supervised, Unsupervised, and Reinforcement Learning to {{audience, e.g., a business manager}}. Include: 1) Core idea of each type, 2) Simple analogy for each, 3) Example use cases (e.g., spam detection, customer segmentation, game playing), 4) Type of data required.

title: Gamifying the Learning Process
prompt: Act as a Gamification Designer. Suggest ways to gamify the process of learning {{Subject or Skill}}. Include ideas for: 1) Points and rewards system, 2) Progress tracking and levels, 3) Challenges and quests, 4) Leaderboards or social elements, 5) Badges or achievements. Ensure alignment with learning goals.

title: Introduction to Systems Thinking
prompt: Act as a Systems Thinking Educator. Explain the core principles of systems thinking. Include: 1) Definition of a system, 2) Concepts like feedback loops, stocks and flows, delays, and leverage points, 3) Importance of seeing interconnections, 4) Example application to {{Simple System, e.g., a thermostat, a bathtub}}.

title: Peer Teaching Session Plan
prompt: Act as an Educational Facilitator. Design a structure for a peer teaching session where students teach each other {{Specific Topic}}. Include: 1) Preparation guidelines for the 'teacher', 2) Format for the teaching segment, 3) Activities for the 'learners' (e.g., Q&A, practice problems), 4) Feedback mechanism, 5) Role rotation plan.

title: Learning Plan for {{Certification}}
prompt: Act as a Certification Coach. Create a detailed study plan to prepare for the {{Specific Certification Exam, e.g., PMP, AWS Certified Cloud Practitioner}}. Include: 1) Breakdown of exam objectives/domains, 2) Recommended study resources (official guides, practice exams), 3) Weekly schedule allocating time per domain, 4) Practice test strategy, 5) Final review plan.

title: Summarizing a Complex Article/Book Chapter
prompt: Act as an Academic Tutor. Provide a structured method for summarizing a complex article or book chapter on {{Subject}}. Include steps for: 1) Initial skim for structure, 2) Identifying the main argument/thesis, 3) Noting key supporting points/evidence per section, 4) Drafting a concise summary in own words, 5) Reviewing for accuracy and clarity.

title: Developing Scientific Literacy
prompt: Act as a Science Educator. Create a guide for developing scientific literacy for the general public. Include: 1) Understanding the scientific method, 2) Differentiating correlation from causation, 3) Evaluating sources of scientific information, 4) Recognizing pseudoscience, 5) Understanding uncertainty in science.

title: Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Software Bug
prompt: Act as a Senior Software Engineer. Conduct a Root Cause Analysis for a recurring software bug described as {{Bug Description}}. Include: 1) A clear problem statement, 2) A timeline of events leading to the bug's discovery/recurrence, 3) Potential causes identified using a method like the 5 Whys or Fishbone diagram, 4) Data/evidence supporting the identified root cause, 5) Recommended corrective and preventive actions.

title: Troubleshooting Network Connectivity
prompt: Act as a Network Administrator. Outline a systematic troubleshooting process for diagnosing network connectivity issues reported by users in {{Specific Network Segment or Location}}. Include steps for: 1) Gathering initial information from the user, 2) Checking physical layer connectivity, 3) Verifying IP configuration (DHCP, static IP), 4) Testing network layer connectivity (ping, traceroute), 5) Checking DNS resolution, 6) Investigating firewall/proxy issues.

title: Resolving Customer Complaint Escalation
prompt: Act as a Customer Support Manager. Develop a strategy for resolving an escalated customer complaint regarding {{Specific Issue}}. Include: 1) Acknowledging the customer's frustration, 2) Investigating the complaint history and details, 3) Identifying possible solutions or concessions, 4) A communication plan for contacting the customer, 5) Steps for internal follow-up to prevent recurrence.

title: Debugging Complex Algorithm Logic
prompt: Act as a Computer Scientist. Devise a debugging strategy for an algorithm intended to {{Algorithm's Purpose}} that is producing incorrect results for {{Specific Input Case}}. Include: 1) Identifying expected vs. actual output, 2) Techniques for tracing execution (e.g., print statements, debugger), 3) Isolating the problematic section of the code, 4) Formulating hypotheses for the logic error, 5) Designing test cases to verify the fix.

title: Contingency Planning for Project Delays
prompt: Act as a Project Manager. Develop a contingency plan to address potential delays in the {{Specific Project Phase}} of the {{Project Name}} project. Include: 1) Identification of key risk factors for delay, 2) Trigger points for activating the contingency plan, 3) Pre-defined mitigation strategies (e.g., resource reallocation, scope reduction, fast-tracking), 4) Communication plan for stakeholders, 5) Impact analysis on budget and final deadline.

title: Mediating Inter-Team Conflict
prompt: Act as a Mediator or HR Business Partner. Outline a process for mediating a conflict between {{Team A}} and {{Team B}} regarding {{Source of Conflict}}. Include: 1) Initial individual meetings to understand perspectives, 2) Structuring a joint mediation session, 3) Ground rules for communication, 4) Techniques for identifying common ground and potential solutions, 5) Documenting agreements and follow-up actions.

title: Optimizing Slow Database Query
prompt: Act as a Database Administrator (DBA). Analyze and propose optimizations for a slow-performing SQL query: `{{SQL Query Snippet}}`. Include: 1) Methods for analyzing the query execution plan, 2) Potential issues (e.g., missing indexes, inefficient joins, table scans), 3) Recommended indexing strategies, 4) Query rewriting suggestions, 5) Considerations for database statistics and configuration.

title: Improving Low Sales Performance
prompt: Act as a Sales Director. Analyze the reasons for low sales performance in {{Specific Region or Product Line}} and propose an improvement plan. Include: 1) Data points to analyze (e.g., conversion rates, lead quality, competitor activity), 2) Potential root causes (e.g., training gaps, market changes, pricing issues), 3) Specific, measurable actions for the sales team, 4) Required support from marketing/product teams, 5) Metrics for tracking progress.

title: Addressing Negative Product Feedback
prompt: Act as a Product Manager. Develop a strategy to address consistent negative feedback regarding {{Specific Product Feature or Aspect}}. Include: 1) Methods for collecting and categorizing feedback, 2) Prioritization framework for addressing issues, 3) Potential solutions (e.g., bug fixes, UX improvements, feature redesign), 4) Communication plan for users, 5) Process for validating the effectiveness of changes.

title: Identifying Manufacturing Bottlenecks
prompt: Act as an Industrial Engineer or Operations Manager. Outline a method for identifying and addressing bottlenecks in the {{Specific Manufacturing Process}}. Include: 1) Data collection techniques (e.g., time studies, process mapping), 2) Methods for identifying the constraint (e.g., Theory of Constraints), 3) Strategies for elevating the bottleneck's capacity, 4) Subordinating other processes to the bottleneck, 5) Continuous monitoring and improvement.

title: Reducing Employee Turnover Strategy
prompt: Act as an HR Strategist. Develop a strategy to reduce high employee turnover in the {{Specific Department or Role}}. Include: 1) Analyzing exit interview data and employee surveys, 2) Identifying potential root causes (e.g., compensation, management, career growth), 3) Proposed interventions (e.g., improving onboarding, enhancing benefits, leadership training), 4) Implementation plan and timeline, 5) Metrics for measuring success.

title: Solving Event Logistics Challenge
prompt: Act as an Event Planner. Address the logistical challenge of {{Specific Challenge, e.g., transporting 500 attendees between venues, managing registration for simultaneous workshops}} for the upcoming {{Event Name}}. Include: 1) Detailed breakdown of the challenge, 2) Proposed solutions and alternatives, 3) Resource requirements (staff, budget, technology), 4) Risk assessment and contingency plans, 5) Communication plan for involved parties.

title: Creating Technical Workaround
prompt: Act as a Solutions Architect. Devise a technical workaround for the limitation that {{Specific Technical Limitation}} prevents {{Desired Outcome}}. Include: 1) Clear definition of the limitation and desired outcome, 2) Brainstormed potential workarounds, 3) Evaluation of workarounds based on feasibility, cost, and stability, 4) Detailed steps for the chosen workaround, 5) Potential risks or side effects of the workaround.

title: Diagnosing Hardware Failure
prompt: Act as a Hardware Technician. Outline the diagnostic steps to identify the cause of failure in a {{Specific Hardware Device, e.g., server, laptop}} exhibiting {{Symptoms of Failure}}. Include: 1) Initial checks (power, connections), 2) Using built-in diagnostics or BIOS/UEFI tools, 3) Isolating components (RAM, HDD/SSD, GPU), 4) Testing with known good components, 5) Interpreting error codes or beep patterns.

title: Improving Website Conversion Rate
prompt: Act as a Conversion Rate Optimization (CRO) Specialist. Analyze why the conversion rate for {{Specific Goal, e.g., newsletter sign-ups, product purchases}} on {{Website/Page}} is low and propose improvements. Include: 1) Key metrics to analyze (bounce rate, time on page, funnel drop-off), 2) Tools for analysis (analytics, heatmaps, user testing), 3) Hypotheses for low conversion, 4) Proposed A/B tests or changes, 5) Success metrics.

title: Addressing Project Scope Creep
prompt: Act as a Project Manager. Develop a strategy to manage and control scope creep identified in the {{Project Name}} project, where {{Description of Scope Creep}}. Include: 1) Documenting the requested changes vs. original scope, 2) Assessing the impact of changes (time, cost, resources), 3) Change control process to follow, 4) Communication plan with stakeholders regarding impact and decisions, 5) Strategies for preventing future uncontrolled scope creep.

title: Resolving Supply Chain Disruption
prompt: Act as a Supply Chain Manager. Develop an immediate response plan to the disruption caused by {{Cause of Disruption, e.g., supplier bankruptcy, transportation strike}} affecting the supply of {{Specific Product/Material}}. Include: 1) Assessing the impact on inventory and production, 2) Identifying alternative suppliers or transportation methods, 3) Communication plan for internal teams and customers, 4) Short-term mitigation actions, 5) Long-term risk reduction strategies.

title: Handling a Public Relations Crisis
prompt: Act as a Public Relations Director. Outline the initial steps to manage a PR crisis arising from {{Cause of Crisis, e.g., negative product review viral, employee misconduct}}. Include: 1) Gathering accurate information, 2) Forming a crisis response team, 3) Developing key messages and holding statements, 4) Identifying primary communication channels, 5) Monitoring media and social media sentiment, 6) Planning follow-up actions.

title: Diagnosing Declining User Engagement
prompt: Act as a Product Analyst. Investigate the cause of declining user engagement (e.g., lower DAU/MAU, reduced feature usage) for {{Specific Product or Platform}}. Include: 1) Key engagement metrics to track, 2) Data segmentation for analysis (user cohorts, demographics, platform), 3) Potential hypotheses (e.g., new competition, UI changes, technical issues), 4) Methods for testing hypotheses (surveys, A/B tests, data analysis), 5) Recommendations based on findings.

title: Optimizing Team Resource Allocation
prompt: Act as a Team Lead or Resource Manager. Develop a method for optimizing the allocation of team members across multiple competing projects: {{List of Projects and Priorities}}. Include: 1) Assessing skill requirements for each project, 2) Evaluating team member skills and availability, 3) Prioritization framework for tasks/projects, 4) Tools or techniques for visualizing allocation (e.g., Gantt chart, Kanban board), 5) Process for handling conflicts and adjustments.

title: Debugging System Integration Issues
prompt: Act as an Integration Specialist. Outline a process for debugging integration issues between {{System A}} and {{System B}}, where {{Description of Issue, e.g., data not syncing, API calls failing}}. Include: 1) Verifying connectivity and authentication, 2) Checking API logs on both systems, 3) Testing with simplified data payloads, 4) Validating data formats and transformations, 5) Isolating the point of failure (source system, middleware, target system).

title: Solving a Complex Mathematical Problem
prompt: Act as a Mathematician. Outline a structured approach to solving the following complex mathematical problem: {{Problem Statement}}. Include: 1) Understanding the problem and identifying key information/constraints, 2) Breaking the problem down into smaller parts, 3) Identifying relevant mathematical concepts or theorems, 4) Trying different approaches or representations, 5) Verifying the solution and checking for edge cases.

title: Strategy for Competitive Market Entry
prompt: Act as a Business Strategist. Develop a strategy for {{Your Company}} to enter the highly competitive market for {{Product/Service Type}}, currently dominated by {{Key Competitors}}. Include: 1) Identifying a unique value proposition or niche, 2) Target customer segment analysis, 3) Proposed pricing and positioning strategy, 4) Go-to-market plan (marketing, sales channels), 5) Key risks and mitigation strategies.

title: Addressing Security Vulnerabilities
prompt: Act as a Cybersecurity Analyst. A security vulnerability ({{Vulnerability Description, e.g., CVE-XXXX-YYYY}}) has been identified in {{Affected System/Software}}. Outline a plan to address it. Include: 1) Assessing the severity and potential impact, 2) Identifying affected assets, 3) Evaluating available patches or mitigation techniques, 4) Planning and executing remediation steps, 5) Verification and post-remediation monitoring.

title: Improving Data Quality
prompt: Act as a Data Steward or Data Quality Analyst. Develop a plan to improve the quality of data in the {{Specific Dataset or Database}}, which suffers from {{Data Quality Issues, e.g., incompleteness, inconsistency, inaccuracy}}. Include: 1) Defining data quality metrics, 2) Profiling the data to identify specific issues, 3) Root cause analysis of quality problems, 4) Data cleansing and validation rules, 5) Implementing preventative measures.

title: Resolving Project Budget Overruns
prompt: Act as a Project Controller or Manager. Address the budget overrun identified in the {{Project Name}} project, currently exceeding the budget by {{Amount/Percentage}}. Include: 1) Analyzing the causes of the overrun (e.g., scope creep, estimation errors, unexpected costs), 2) Identifying areas for potential cost savings, 3) Evaluating impact on project scope and timeline, 4) Developing revised forecast and budget request, 5) Communicating with stakeholders.

title: Finding Solutions for Accessibility Barriers
prompt: Act as an Accessibility Specialist. Identify solutions to address the accessibility barrier where {{Description of Barrier, e.g., website not navigable by screen reader, physical entrance lacks ramp}} for {{Product/Service/Location}}. Include: 1) Understanding relevant accessibility standards (e.g., WCAG, ADA), 2) Evaluating different technical or physical solutions, 3) Assessing feasibility and cost, 4) Prioritizing solutions based on impact, 5) Recommending an implementation plan.

title: Troubleshooting Deployment Failures
prompt: Act as a DevOps Engineer. Outline a troubleshooting process for a deployment failure of {{Application Name}} to the {{Environment Name}} environment, with the error message: {{Error Message}}. Include: 1) Reviewing deployment logs, 2) Checking environment configuration (variables, dependencies), 3) Verifying infrastructure health (servers, database, network), 4) Attempting rollback or redeployment, 5) Analyzing code changes since last successful deployment.

title: Strategy for Handling Difficult Clients
prompt: Act as an Account Manager or Consultant. Develop a strategy for managing a difficult client relationship with {{Client Name}}, characterized by {{Difficult Behaviors, e.g., constant scope changes, unrealistic demands, poor communication}}. Include: 1) Identifying the root causes of the difficulty, 2) Setting clear boundaries and expectations, 3) Improving communication protocols, 4) Documenting agreements and changes, 5) Escalation plan if necessary.

title: Optimizing User Onboarding Flow
prompt: Act as a UX Designer or Product Manager. Analyze and propose optimizations for the user onboarding flow of {{Specific App/Service}}, where users are dropping off at {{Specific Step}}. Include: 1) Analyzing user behavior data (funnel analysis), 2) Gathering qualitative feedback (user interviews, surveys), 3) Identifying friction points and usability issues, 4) Brainstorming solutions (e.g., simplifying steps, adding guidance, improving UI), 5) Planning A/B tests to validate changes.

title: Solving Multi-Team Scheduling Conflict
prompt: Act as a Program Manager. Resolve a scheduling conflict where {{Team A}} and {{Team B}} both require {{Shared Resource or Key Person}} during the same critical period {{Time Period}}. Include: 1) Understanding the priorities and deadlines of both teams, 2) Facilitating a negotiation between team leads, 3) Exploring alternative scheduling options (e.g., staggering work, finding alternative resources), 4) Documenting the agreed-upon resolution, 5) Adjusting overall program plan if necessary.

title: Addressing Ethical Dilemmas in Project
prompt: Act as an Ethics Officer or Senior Manager. Outline a process for addressing an ethical dilemma encountered in the {{Project Name}} project, related to {{Ethical Issue, e.g., data privacy concerns, potential conflict of interest}}. Include: 1) Clearly defining the ethical dilemma, 2) Identifying relevant company policies or ethical codes, 3) Considering different stakeholder perspectives, 4) Evaluating potential courses of action and their consequences, 5) Documenting the decision-making process and rationale.

title: Root Cause of Inconsistent Test Results
prompt: Act as a QA Lead or Test Engineer. Investigate the root cause of inconsistent ('flaky') test results for the automated test suite covering {{Specific Feature or Module}}. Include: 1) Analyzing test execution logs and failure patterns, 2) Checking for issues in the test environment stability, 3) Reviewing test code for race conditions or timing dependencies, 4) Investigating potential issues in the application under test, 5) Proposing fixes or improvements to test reliability.

title: Improving Team Communication Breakdowns
prompt: Act as a Team Facilitator or Manager. Address communication breakdowns observed within the {{Team Name}} team, leading to {{Consequences, e.g., missed deadlines, duplicated work}}. Include: 1) Identifying specific examples and patterns of breakdown, 2) Facilitating a team discussion or retrospective, 3) Establishing clearer communication channels and protocols, 4) Implementing tools or practices (e.g., daily stand-ups, shared documentation), 5) Follow-up and reinforcement.

title: Developing Technical Debt Management Plan
prompt: Act as a Technical Lead or Architect. Develop a plan for managing the identified technical debt in the {{Specific System or Application}}. Include: 1) Cataloging and prioritizing existing technical debt items, 2) Estimating the effort required for remediation, 3) Allocating capacity for debt reduction within development cycles, 4) Strategies for preventing new technical debt, 5) Communicating the plan and progress to stakeholders.

title: Logical Deduction Puzzle Solving
prompt: Act as a Logician or Puzzle Solver. Apply logical deduction to solve the following puzzle: {{Puzzle Description with rules and clues}}. Include: 1) Representing the known information clearly (e.g., using a grid or list), 2) Systematically applying the rules and clues to deduce new information, 3) Identifying contradictions to eliminate possibilities, 4) Showing the step-by-step reasoning process, 5) Stating the final solution.

title: Diagnosing Web Application Performance Issues
prompt: Act as a Performance Engineer. Diagnose the cause of slow performance reported for the {{Specific Web Application}}, particularly during {{Specific Action or Time}}. Include: 1) Defining performance metrics (e.g., load time, TTFB, response time), 2) Using browser developer tools for frontend analysis, 3) Employing server-side profiling tools, 4) Analyzing database query performance, 5) Checking infrastructure resource utilization (CPU, RAM, network).

title: Resolving Requirements Gathering Conflicts
prompt: Act as a Business Analyst or Product Owner. Address conflicting requirements provided by {{Stakeholder Group A}} and {{Stakeholder Group B}} for the {{Specific Feature or Project}}. Include: 1) Clearly documenting each conflicting requirement, 2) Facilitating a discussion with both stakeholder groups, 3) Identifying the underlying needs behind the requirements, 4) Exploring potential compromises or alternative solutions, 5) Gaining consensus and documenting the final requirement.

title: Finding Alternative Solutions (Plan B)
prompt: Act as a Strategic Planner. The primary plan to achieve {{Objective}} by {{Method A}} has encountered a major obstacle: {{Obstacle Description}}. Develop alternative solutions (Plan B). Include: 1) Re-evaluating the core objective, 2) Brainstorming alternative methods or approaches, 3) Assessing the feasibility, cost, and risks of each alternative, 4) Recommending the most viable Plan B, 5) Outlining the initial steps for the alternative plan.

title: Addressing User Experience Friction Points
prompt: Act as a UX Researcher. Analyze user feedback and behavior data to identify and address friction points in the process of {{Specific User Task}} within {{Application/Website}}. Include: 1) Methods for identifying friction (e.g., usability testing, analytics, feedback analysis), 2) Pinpointing specific steps or UI elements causing issues, 3) Hypothesizing the reasons for friction, 4) Proposing design solutions or improvements, 5) Planning validation testing.

title: Optimizing System Energy Consumption
prompt: Act as a Systems Engineer or Sustainability Officer. Propose strategies to optimize the energy consumption of the {{Specific System, e.g., data center, building HVAC, software application}}. Include: 1) Methods for measuring current energy usage, 2) Identifying major energy-consuming components or processes, 3) Evaluating potential optimization techniques (e.g., hardware upgrades, software algorithms, operational changes), 4) Estimating potential savings and costs, 5) Recommending an implementation plan.

title: Solving Inventory Management Problems
prompt: Act as an Inventory Manager or Operations Analyst. Address the problem of {{Specific Inventory Problem, e.g., frequent stockouts of Item X, high holding costs for Item Y}} in the warehouse. Include: 1) Analyzing historical demand and inventory data, 2) Reviewing current forecasting and replenishment methods, 3) Identifying potential causes (e.g., inaccurate forecasts, long lead times, poor storage), 4) Proposing solutions (e.g., adjusting safety stock, improving forecasting model, optimizing reorder points), 5) Metrics for evaluating improvement.

title: Strategy for Unexpected Market Changes
prompt: Act as a Business Strategist. Develop a response strategy to the unexpected market change where {{Description of Market Change, e.g., new competitor entry, sudden shift in consumer preference, new regulation}}. Include: 1) Assessing the immediate impact on the business, 2) Analyzing long-term implications and opportunities/threats, 3) Evaluating potential strategic responses (e.g., pivot, adapt product, change pricing, form partnerships), 4) Recommending a course of action with rationale, 5) Outlining key implementation steps.

title: Troubleshooting Third-Party API Issues
prompt: Act as a Software Developer. Troubleshoot issues encountered while integrating with the {{Third-Party Service Name}} API, specifically {{Description of Issue, e.g., authentication errors, unexpected response format, rate limiting}}. Include: 1) Reviewing the official API documentation, 2) Checking API status pages or forums, 3) Verifying your request format and parameters, 4) Using tools like Postman or cURL for isolated testing, 5) Examining logs for detailed error messages, 6) Considering contacting their support.

title: Improving Forecasting Model Accuracy
prompt: Act as a Data Scientist. Analyze why the current forecasting model for {{Metric being forecast, e.g., sales demand, website traffic}} is inaccurate and propose improvements. Include: 1) Evaluating current model performance metrics (e.g., MAE, RMSE, MAPE), 2) Analyzing residuals for patterns, 3) Investigating data quality and feature relevance, 4) Exploring alternative models or hyperparameter tuning, 5) Proposing a plan for retraining and validation.

title: Resolving Data Privacy Concerns
prompt: Act as a Data Privacy Officer or Legal Counsel. Address data privacy concerns raised regarding {{Specific Process or Data Usage, e.g., collection of user location data, sharing data with third parties}}. Include: 1) Understanding the specific concerns raised, 2) Reviewing relevant privacy regulations (e.g., GDPR, CCPA), 3) Assessing current data handling practices against policies and regulations, 4) Identifying gaps or risks, 5) Recommending corrective actions or policy changes.

title: Root Cause of Intermittent System Crashes
prompt: Act as a Site Reliability Engineer (SRE). Investigate the root cause of intermittent crashes occurring in the {{Specific System or Service}}. Include: 1) Correlating crash times with system logs (application, OS, database), 2) Analyzing resource utilization patterns (CPU, memory, disk I/O) around crash times, 3) Investigating recent code deployments or configuration changes, 4) Looking for specific error messages or stack traces, 5) Designing experiments or monitoring to reproduce or capture more data.

title: Developing Negotiation Strategy
prompt: Act as a Negotiation Specialist. Develop a negotiation strategy for an upcoming negotiation with {{Counterparty Name}} regarding {{Subject of Negotiation, e.g., contract renewal, partnership terms}}. Include: 1) Defining your objectives and priorities, 2) Identifying your Best Alternative to a Negotiated Agreement (BATNA), 3) Researching the counterparty's potential interests and BATNA, 4) Developing potential concessions and trade-offs, 5) Planning the opening moves and communication approach.

title: Optimizing Hiring Process
prompt: Act as a Recruitment Manager. Analyze and propose optimizations for the hiring process for {{Specific Role or Department}}, which is currently {{Problem, e.g., too slow, attracting unqualified candidates}}. Include: 1) Mapping the current hiring workflow, 2) Identifying bottlenecks or inefficient steps, 3) Analyzing candidate sourcing channels, 4) Reviewing job descriptions and screening criteria, 5) Proposing changes (e.g., improving interview structure, using assessment tools, streamlining approvals).

title: Solving Design Challenge with Constraints
prompt: Act as a Designer (e.g., UX, Product, Graphic). Develop a solution for the design challenge: {{Design Challenge Description}}, given the constraints: {{List of Constraints, e.g., limited budget, specific technology, tight deadline, accessibility requirements}}. Include: 1) Clarifying the challenge and constraints, 2) Brainstorming potential solutions within the constraints, 3) Evaluating solutions against challenge goals and constraints, 4) Prototyping or mocking up the chosen solution, 5) Justifying design decisions.

title: Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) Report
prompt: Act as a Data Analyst. Perform an Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA) on the provided dataset: {{Dataset Description or Link}}. Your report should include: 1) Summary statistics for key variables, 2) Identification and handling strategy for missing values, 3) Univariate analysis (distributions, counts) for important features, 4) Bivariate analysis (correlations, comparisons) to uncover relationships, 5) Initial visualizations (histograms, scatter plots, box plots) to illustrate findings. Document your code and observations.

title: A/B Test Result Analysis
prompt: Act as a Data Scientist. Analyze the results of an A/B test comparing {{Control Version}} and {{Variant Version}} for the metric {{Key Metric, e.g., conversion rate, click-through rate}}. Include: 1) Calculation of the key metric for both groups, 2) Statistical significance testing (e.g., t-test, chi-squared test) with p-value and confidence intervals, 3) Practical significance assessment, 4) Recommendation on whether to launch the variant, 5) Visualizations comparing the groups.

title: Customer Churn Prediction Model
prompt: Act as a Machine Learning Engineer. Build a model to predict customer churn based on {{Dataset Description with features like usage, demographics, tenure}}. Include: 1) Data preprocessing steps (cleaning, encoding, scaling), 2) Feature selection or engineering, 3) Training and evaluation of at least two classification models (e.g., Logistic Regression, Random Forest), 4) Key performance metrics (Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-score, AUC), 5) Interpretation of feature importance.

title: Sales Performance Dashboard Design
prompt: Act as a BI Analyst. Design a dashboard to visualize sales performance for {{Product Line or Region}}. Include: 1) Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) like Total Sales, Average Deal Size, Win Rate, Sales Cycle Length, 2) Trend analysis charts (e.g., sales over time), 3) Performance comparison visuals (e.g., by region, by salesperson), 4) Interactive filters (e.g., date range, product), 5) A clean and intuitive layout.

title: Time Series Forecasting for Inventory
prompt: Act as a Data Scientist. Develop a time series model to forecast demand for {{Specific Product}} for the next {{Forecast Horizon, e.g., 3 months}}. Use historical sales data {{Data Description}}. Include: 1) Time series decomposition (trend, seasonality, residuals), 2) Model selection (e.g., ARIMA, Prophet, Exponential Smoothing), 3) Model training and validation, 4) Forecast generation with confidence intervals, 5) Evaluation metrics (e.g., MAE, RMSE, MAPE).

title: Data Cleaning Strategy Document
prompt: Act as a Data Quality Analyst. Outline a data cleaning strategy for the dataset {{Dataset Description}}, known to have issues like {{Specific Issues, e.g., inconsistent formats, outliers, duplicates}}. Include: 1) Identification of data quality dimensions to address, 2) Specific rules for handling missing values, 3) Methods for detecting and treating outliers, 4) Strategy for identifying and merging/removing duplicates, 5) Validation checks post-cleaning.

title: Customer Segmentation using Clustering
prompt: Act as a Data Scientist. Perform customer segmentation using clustering techniques (e.g., K-Means, DBSCAN) on the dataset {{Dataset Description with customer attributes}}. Include: 1) Feature selection and scaling, 2) Determining the optimal number of clusters (e.g., Elbow method, Silhouette score), 3) Applying the clustering algorithm, 4) Profiling the resulting segments based on their characteristics, 5) Visualizing the clusters.

title: SQL Query for Top N Analysis
